question_text:
What is the median of the following data set?
2, 1, 2, 6, 2, 3, 2
solution: Remember, the median is the middle number. It is found by ordering all data points and picking out the one in the middle. Or, if there are two middle numbers, take the mean of those two numbers.

First, arrange the numbers from least to greatest:
1, 2, 2, 2, 2, 3, 6
Now find the number right in the middle of the sequence.
The number in the middle is 2, so the median is 2.
